quizzes.title: History Quiz: Sigmund Freud and Goblins
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, actor, freud. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The play Inherit the Wind was written almost five years before its opening. Why did it take so long to get the play produced?

options.text: The Great Depression hurt Broadway producers.
The public did not want a play about abortions.
The public did not want a play about Sacco and Vanzetti.
Fear of the McCarthy HUAC hearings

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fear of the McCarthy HUAC hearings

questions.question: Goblins are considered to be a type of fairy folk.
It is believed that the goblin legend began in what European country?
Which of these statements about goblins is NOT true according to legend?

options.text: Goblins are almost an entirely male race.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Goblins love horse meat.

questions.question: Sigmund Freud used this drug and prescribed it to his patients as an analgesic and antidepressant.
What phobia did Sigmund Freud develop in his forties?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fear of death

questions.question: It is a very old tradition to portray goblins green.
What was the reason for the fallout between Sigmund Freud and Carl Jung, who was initially a supporter of Freud?

options.text: Jung poked fun at Freuds ideas about dreams.
Freud found some of Jungs ideas unscientific.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Freud found some of Jungs ideas unscientific.

questions.question: The word goblin is probably derived from a Latin word which means what?
Which of these historical figures was a patient of Sigmund Freud?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: The Green Goblin is the arch enemy of which Marvel Superhero?
Sigmund Freud, who was a heavy cigar smoker, developed this disease.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Oral cancer

questions.question: Goblin babies are known as changelings.
Which actor won a 1988 Emmy for his portrayal of the defense lawyer in one of the TV versions of the 1955 play Inherit the Wind?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jason Robards, Jr.

questions.question: What was Sigmund Freuds major at the University of Vienna?

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Mona Lisa and Sigmund Freud
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, freud, mean. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What does the German word Bibliothek mean when translated into English?
When Mona Lisa was stolen in 1911, Picasso was among the suspects.
What are the two contradictory desires that drive every human being according to Sigmund Freud?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Life and death

questions.question: How long did it take Leonardo Da Vinci to finish the Mona Lisa painting?
Which of these is not among the theories about who is portrayed in the Mona Lisa painting?

options.text: The portrait is an idealization of all womanhood.
The portrait is an invention of Leonardos imagination
The mistress of Leonardos close friend

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The mistress of Leonardos close friend

questions.question: Who gave the Mona Lisa painting its name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Giorgio Vasari

questions.question: What name was used to refer to Leonardos famous painting before it was known as Mona Lisa?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A Certain Florentine Lady

questions.question: The Mona Lisa is not painted on a canvas.
What sentence was Vincenzo Perugia given for stealing the Mona Lisa painting in 1911?
What part of the human psyche contains the child-like drives and desires according to Sigmund Freud?
Which of these therapies did Sigmund Freud start using to resolve psychological problems?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Talk therapy

questions.question: Which of these artists is known to have become fascinated with the Mona Lisa painting?
What was the Mona Lisa painting called when it was in the collection at the palace at Fontainebleau?

options.text: A courtesan in a gauze veil

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A courtesan in a gauze veil

questions.question: How did Sigmund Freud choose to die, with the assistance of his doctor and friend Max Schur?

options.text: By a lethal dose of morphine

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: By a lethal dose of morphine

questions.question: Which King hated the Mona Lisa painting so much, that he had it removed from his palace?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: King Louis XV

quizzes.title: History Quiz: English and Phrase
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, mean, شب. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What does the Farsi phrase شب بخير  (shab bekheyr) mean in English?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Good night

questions.question: Which ancient author wrote Ten Books of Architecture, a work that contained the principles followed by Renaissance architects?
What does the Hebrew word זהב (za-hav) translate to in English?
What does the Danish word fødselsdag mean in English? (foudgshlsdag)
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Your Birthday

questions.question: Who wrote Divina Proportione which explored the use of the golden ratio in the Renaissance architecture?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Luca Pacioli

questions.question: Italian Mannerism is a term related to the High Renaissance.
In which year was the term photography first used?
What does the Spanish Word lechuga mean in English?
What does the Hebrew phrase להתראות (le-hei-tra-ot) mean in English?
What does the Greek word Βοήθεια (Voíthia) mean in English?
This Renaissance architect, famous as chief architect of the Venetian Republic, wrote the treatise Four Books on Architecture.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Andrea Palladio

questions.question: What is the English equivalent of the Russian phrase Добро пожаловать (Dobro požalovat)?
What does the Latin phrase Ave Maria mean in English?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hail Mary

questions.question: Who was the first architect since antiquity to use the classical orders Doric, Ionic and Corinthian in an appropriate manner?
What does the Czech phrase Dobrý den mean in English?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Good Day/Hello

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Edward Hopper and Photographs
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, detail, college. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which great singer/songwriter wrote the song Photographs and Memories?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jim Croce

questions.question: In Europe, Edward Hopper visited the Louvre Museum where he saw Degas painting The Cotton Exchange, New Orleans. He called it the most wonderful painting he had ever seen.
One can be amazed at the great detail and lack of distortion in the photographs of Civil War photographer Matthew Brady. What is the major reason for this?

options.text: Outdoor photographs are always better than indoor photographs.
He used a really big camera.
He used only the purest of chemicals in his darkroom.
He used linen rather than paper for his pictures.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He used a really big camera.

questions.question: This famous photojournalist specialized in war photographs. He covered the Spanish Civil War, The Second Sino-Japanese War, World War II (He landed on Omaha Beach!) ,The Israeli War for Independence, and The French-Indochina  War. What was his name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Robert Capra

questions.question: When was the first permanently colored photograph taken?
What term refers to amyotrophic lateral sclerosis?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lou Gehrigs Disease

questions.question: Which phrase refers to a costly victory that results in losses so high as to make you wonder whether it was worth it?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pyrrhic victory

questions.question: He was a great American photographer and one of the inventors of the Zone System. He is probably best known for his images of Yosemite National Park. What is his name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ansel Adams

questions.question: When was the first picture of a university class taken?
When was the first digital camera introduced?
In 1945 this man was given the Pulitzer Prize in News Photography for his famous photo of the raising the American flag on the Japanese island Iwo Jima.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Joe Rosenthal

questions.question: When was the first aerial photograph taken?
When was the first underwater photograph taken?
During the four years after he finished college, Edward Hopper made how many trips to Europe?
In the same year Jesse James was shot and killed, Edward Hopper was born.  What was the year?

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Meaning and Edward Hopper
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, mean, nivison. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What color does the Spanish word ‘verde’ denote?
Where does Edward Hoppers most famous painting, “Nighthawks”, reside?

options.text: Museum of Modern Art in New York
The Whitney Museum of American Art

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Art Institute of Chicago

questions.question: What is the meaning of the Spanish expression ‘tengo sed’?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: I am thirsty

questions.question: What is the meaning of the Spanish word ‘ordenador’?
What part of the human body does the Spanish word ‘dedo’ denote?
What number does the Spanish word ‘cien’ denote?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A hundred

questions.question: What is the meaning of the Spanish phrase ‘Le invito a almorzar’?

options.text: I was invited to a wedding
We are moving to a house

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: I’m inviting you to lunch

questions.question: What was Edward Hoppers occupation in his forties?

options.text: He ran his familys grocery store

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A commercial illustrator

questions.question: What family member does the Spanish noun ‘abuela’ denote?
After Edward Hopper married painter Josephine Nivison, she became the only model for all of his female figures.
Which day of the week does the Spanish word ‘martes’ denote?
Edward Hopper once said, The only real influence Ive ever had was myself.
What is the Spanish word for mirror?
At what age did Edward Hopper have his first one-man show of paintings?
What does the Spanish expression ‘Me he perdido el bolso’ mean?

options.text: I need to see the doctor

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: I lost my bag

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Language and Country
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, denmark, country. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In what Asian country is the Nuosu language, also called Northern Yi, Liangshan Yi, Nosu, and Sichuan Yi, spoken?
What is the official language in Scotland?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: None of these

questions.question: What is the official language of Andorra, a small country in southwestern Europe bordered by Spain and France?
What is the official language of Denmark?
Is it true that according to Greek myths Arachne had great respect for Athena?
The Igbo language is one of the official languages in this African country.
The Afrikaans language is one of the official languages in this African country.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: South Africa

questions.question: The Greek language has an official status on this Mediterranean island.
How was Prometheus punished for stealing fire and bringing it to humans?

options.text: He was hung up on a mountain where every day a crow came and ate his liver.
He had to hold the sky up.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: None of these

questions.question: In which of these countries is Spanish not an official language?
Who is the mother of Dionysus?
On what continent is the Ga language spoken?
What type of language is the Tigre language, which is the native language of the Tigre people?
Which Greek god guides the dead to the river Styx to pay their toll to Charon so that they can get into the underworld?
In the Western part of the U.S. this word is used to express great enthusiasm.
